meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He welched on his promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: She always welches on her commitments at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The student welched on his agreement to submit the assignment on time.
meanings.sent4: After promising to attend the event, he welched, leaving his friends disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The company welched on their guarantee of satisfaction, angering many customers.

meanings.definition: To swindle or cheat someone out of something.
meanings.sent1: The con artist welched the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent2: He welches people by selling fake products online.
meanings.sent3: The tricky salesman welched the customer out of a fair deal.
meanings.sent4: She felt cheated when he welched her out of the prize she rightfully won.
meanings.sent5: The scammer welched unsuspecting victims out of their money through deceitful schemes.

meanings.definition: To renege on a bet or agreement.
meanings.sent1: He welched on their bet by refusing to pay up.
meanings.sent2: She welches on their agreement to split the winnings.
meanings.sent3: The player welched on the deal, causing tension among the group.
meanings.sent4: They welched on the handshake agreement, leading to a dispute.
meanings.sent5: The gambler welched on the bet, causing uproar among the other players.
